title: Encountered errors resolving bounds after type-checking

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

body:
```

error: internal compiler error: src/librustc/infer/mod.rs:642: Encountered errors `[FulfillmentError(Obligation(predicate=Binder(TraitPredicate(<[closure@<d2dpush macros>:3:1: 6:65 arc:std::sync::Arc<std::sync::Mutex<d2dpush::DockerToDockerRegistry>>] as std::ops::Fn<(&mut iron::Request<'_, '_>,)>>)),depth=1),Unimplemented)]` resolving bounds after type-checking
note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.
note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/blob/master/CONTRIBUTING.md#bug-reports

```

Relevant macro expanded source (or: what I added last before the compiler panicked).

``` rust
let d2d = Arc::new(Mutex::new(DockerToDockerRegistry::new(docker)));
// [...]
router.get("/v2/_catalog",
           {
               let arc = d2d.clone();
               |req: &mut Request| {
               let result =
                   (move |_|
                        arc.lock().unwrap().list_images())(req);
               match result {
                   Ok(out) => {
                       use iron::mime::Mime;
                       let json: Mime =
                           "application/json".parse().unwrap();
                       Ok(Response::with((iron::status::Ok, json,
                                          serde_json::to_string(&out).unwrap())))
                   }
                   Err(err) =>
                   Err(IronError::new(err,
                                      status::InternalServerError)),
               }
           }
           });
```

``` sh
$ rustc --version
rustc 1.10.0
$ cargo --version
cargo 0.11.0-nightly (42bce5c 2016-05-17)
$ uname -r
4.6.3-1-ARCH
```

All packages installed from official Arch Linux repository. All dependencies are unmodified except for rust-docker which use [this fork](https://github.com/nuclearfurnace/rust-docker) plus some dependencies version bumps.

I can post the entire source tree, as this project is planned to be open sourced.
